levels.level-text: Memorize the maze! When the lights go out, touch the screen and describe a path from the green arrow to the green x. Touch the screen to begin.
This maze has obstacles. Remember where they are and avoid them!
This maze has more obstacles. Be careful and take your time. There is no time limit.
This time there is only one way to go.
This is easy, right?
A maze can start anywhere.
A maze can end anywhere.
Sometimes you start at the top...
Sometimes you go from left to right...
Sometimes you go in circles.
Good. So, this maze is a little bigger.
And this maze is perhaps a little harder to memorize.
You can go through this the same way as you did the last, but if you want to score 100% you must touch all empty tiles!
Scoring 100% isn't necessary at all.
Relax, memorize, go in your own pace.
Focus on following patterns.
There is often some kind of repetition you can memorize.
Remember that there is no time limit. Relax.
Take the easiest way first.
Use any shortcuts you can find!
Keep going.
Do it again, but now clockwise.
This is still easy, right?
It will get more difficult, but not yet.
This isn't too hard.
Memorize this a little extra...
Now do the same maze from right to left!
It's a good place to hide.
Step are easy if you don't hurry.
Take your time.
Now let's try a maze that's a little bigger.
More things can go wrong in a larger maze...
But you can handle it!
A little further...
One more step.
The easy way is closed.
You must visit every room.
Just keep calm.
You're doing fine.
Pay attention to where the starting arrow is.
This maze is a little larger. Let's go in circles again!
We'll do the snake thing once more, as well.
And some stairs...
Now you have to think!
Same again, just a little longer.
Up, a little to the left, right, down - easy!
Do it again, only more!
This is easier than it looks.
Is this confusing? Remember to look for patterns!
This shouldn't give you any problems.
Let's try a maze that's a little more open!
This one is so open it's almost not a maze.
Still open, but perhaps a little confusing?
Open and easy, but getting 100% requires patience and good memory.
And now it's even harder
Back to basics: let's try some new patterns.
Steps, steps, steps.
Pay attention!
Symmetric mazes are easy.
Asymmetric mazes are hard.
Either way is fine.
Same here: choose a road and take it.
As usual, there is a pattern.
Patterns, patterns, always patterns.
There is clearly a pattern here.
First it's a circle, then it's a square?
So close, and yet...
Here you are: as many options as you could possible want.
Unfortunately, a level isn't easy just because it gives you more than one option.
It sort of - curves?
You have seen something similar before: relax, take your time, follow the pattern.
It's in there somewhere.
A classic maze with an inconveniently placed entrance.
This is almost the same as last time, but be careful.
Yes, it is as easy as it looks.
It's time to scale up! Let's try out this new maze size with a familiar pattern.
This should also feel familiar, but look closely before you start.
This is still easy, unless you want to score 100%...
But why go for a perfect score?
Here, there really are a lot of places you can go to. Better not even try to visit them all.
This is the largest spiral yet.
Can you change direction halfway through?
Be careful at the corners!
Now you must be even more careful.
Two circles, two holes to find.
A classic maze.
It's a maze: nothing more, nothing less.
A bowl within a bowl.
A couple of boxes.
It's just like a coloring book - stay within the lines!
Down-up, down-up, down...
Can you go both up-down and left-right in the same maze?
If you have managed every maze before this one, you should have no problems here.
The quickest route requires you to make exactly ten turns.
Whatever you do, don't think about claustrophobia.
You are getting close to level 100...
Sieves with only one hole? That's not very practical.
It's in the backyard.
Is this difficult? Maybe, but probably not for you!
This might very well be as hard as it gets.
Just kidding earlier! This maze is a little bigger again, so things can still get harder.
Is it easier when you start in the middle?
Left or right? It's up to you.
Remember that thing about patterns? It sort of applies here.
If you have come this far, you probably don't need more advice. But what about encouragement?
Yes, it's supposed to be difficult.
But difficulty doesn't matter now. You know what to do and how to do it.
Here is a tip, just in case: bounce whenever you hit a wall and you will be fine.
Let's do a classical symmetric maze again. They are always appreciated.
Now have a look at this: no symmetry at all. Very modern.
A good thing here: getting a perfect score isn't much harder than just solving the maze.
I wouldn't worry about this maze if I were you. Just solve it.
There are two ways to go. Which one is best?
A very annoying maze, this one. But it is entertaining!
Going in circles is boring. Luckily this maze has some interesting obstacles.
This maze is the largest yet. What's your finger tip/screen size ratio like?
Concentrate, memorize, go!
Don't worry about getting lost. You can always start over.
Relax. This maze is 'easy'.
Back to basics: just follow the patterns.
An even larger maze?! Don't worry: this is as large as it gets.
For every maze you solve, you get nearer the end...
Are you really only three mazes from The End?
All you have to do here is visit 62 carefully selected squares. In the right order.
And this is it: your final challenge! Enjoy.
Only two tiles!
